docs.snippet: An offer to invest $20,000,000 as its share of the cost of building two large, fast passenger liners for operation in the New York-East Coast of South America service was announced yesterday by Albert V. Moore, president of Moore-McCormack Lines.
docs.lead_paragraph: An offer to invest $20,000,000 as its share of the cost of building two large, fast passenger liners for operation in the New York-East Coast of South America service was announced yesterday by Albert V. Moore, president of Moore-McCormack Lines.
docs.abstract: Moore-McCormack offers $20 million to start 2 liners, Washington conf; Smith optimistic

headline.main: $20,000,000 BACKING READY FOR LINERS; A.V. Moore Gets Behind Plan to Put Two Fast Ships on South American Run

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 23 (UP) -- Goar Mestre, president of the Inter-American Association of Broadcasters, charged today that Argentine radio stations "broadcast only the opinions of the Government" and that there was no freedom of expression...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 23 (UP) -- Goar Mestre, president of the Inter-American Association of Broadcasters, charged today that Argentine radio stations "broadcast only the opinions of the Government" and that there was no freedom of expression over the air.
docs.abstract: G Mestre charges Govt radio control

headline.main: ARGENTINE RADIO HIT ANEW; Mestre Says It Broadcasts Only Government Opinion

docs.snippet: CARRASCO, Uruguay, July 25 -- A thirty-foot marble stele was dedicated here this morning to the memory of President Roosevelt. The monument is set in the former Carrasco National Park, in the best-known suburb of Montevideo.
docs.lead_paragraph: CARRASCO, Uruguay, July 25 -- A thirty-foot marble stele was dedicated here this morning to the memory of President Roosevelt. The monument is set in the former Carrasco National Park, in the best-known suburb of Montevideo.
docs.abstract: Marble stele dedicated to F D Roosevelt, Carrasco, Montevideo; Carrasco Natl Pk renamed in hon

headline.main: Monument in Uruguay Dedicated to Roosevelt

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 25 -- Czechoslovakia and Finland, two countries within the orbit of the Soviet Union, were designated today as recipients of minor orders for material under the European Recovery Program to help Western European democracies regain...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 25 -- Czechoslovakia and Finland, two countries within the orbit of the Soviet Union, were designated today as recipients of minor orders for material under the European Recovery Program to help Western European democracies regain their economic strength.

headline.main: Finland, Czechoslovakia to Share In Newest Allotment of ECA Funds; $880,000 Will Be Spent in Two Countries in Soviet Orbit for Materials Needed to Speed Recovery in German Zone

byline.original: By SAMUEL A. TOWERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 26 -- The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization, which will wind up a special conference on Latin-American nutrition Wednesday, looked today to quinoa, an ancient plant considered as sacred by the Incas, as a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 26 -- The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization, which will wind up a special conference on Latin-American nutrition Wednesday, looked today to quinoa, an ancient plant considered as sacred by the Incas, as a possible supplementary food in the Hemisphere to combat malnutrition.
docs.abstract: FAO experts see quinoa as new resource

headline.main: LATIN NATIONS SEE NEW FOOD IN QUINOA; U.N. Group to Study Nutritive Value of Ancient Inca Plant for Upland Indigenes

keywords.value: FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL ORGANIZATION, UNITED NATIONS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 27 -- The regional conference of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization adopted a series of reports today intended primarily to spur Latin American governments to make the most of their own food resources.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 27 -- The regional conference of the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization adopted a series of reports today intended primarily to spur Latin American governments to make the most of their own food resources.

headline.main: FAO ADOPTS RULES TO AID LATIN AMERICA

docs.snippet: LONDON, July 27 (AP) -- The favored American team drew Switzerland today as its first opponent in the Olympic basketball tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, July 27 (AP) -- The favored American team drew Switzerland today as its first opponent in the Olympic basketball tournament.

headline.main: BASKETBALL PLAY STARTS OH FRIDAY; Favored American Team Draws Switzerland as Its First Opponent in Olympics
